body: ## Expected Behavior Task succeeds. ## Actual Behavior The task execution always fails with this BadScheduleActivityAttributes: A valid StartToClose or ScheduleToCloseTimeout is not set on command. ## Steps to Reproduce the Problem this is the first activity ` // step1: generate one approver task content.CurrentApproverID = ApproverID err = workflow.ExecuteActivity(ctx, activities.StoreDomaindata, content).Get(ctx, nil) if err != nil { logger.Error(err.Error()) return content, err } ` // sync domain data: so that they can be queried // should have different apis, just use one for simplicity func (a *ExpenseApprovalActivity) StoreDomaindata(ctx context.Context, transferContent *model.ExpenseApprovalContent) error { message := "callback to store expense data: new approver task, new " activity.GetLogger(ctx).Info(message) return nil } ## Specifications - Version: - go.temporal.io/api v1.7.1-0.20220223032354-6e6fe738916a go.temporal.io/sdk v1.14.0 - Platform: macbookpro m1
title: BadScheduleActivityAttributes, so that task cannot work and hard to debug
